greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of smallest parts of all partitions of n into consecutive parts.
comment: If n is a power of 2 then a(n) = n, the same as A286015(n).
Conjecture: this is also the row sums of A211343.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n = 15 there are four partitions of 15 into consecutive parts: [15], [8, 7], [6, 5, 4] and [5, 4, 3, 2, 1]. The sum of the smallest parts is 15 + 7 + 4 + 1 = 27, so a(15) = 27.
mathematica: Table[Total[Select[IntegerPartitions@ n, Or[Length@ # == 1, Union@ Differences@ # == {-1}] &][[All, -1]]], {n, 66}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 21 2017 *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 30 2017
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, May 01 2017
